BitField.Name: reg000_b5
BitField.Notes: The device is placed in reset when this bit is written high and remains in reset until the bit is written low.

BitField.Name: reg000_b6
BitField.Notes: Serial port communication, LSB or MSB first.

Option.Description: 0 = MSB first
1 = LSB first

BitField.Name: reg000_b7
BitField.Notes: SDIO pin operation.

Option.Description: 0 = SDIO - input only
1 = SDIO - bidirectional input/output

BitField.Name: reg001_b4
BitField.Notes: 1 = power down the auxiliary ADC for temperature sensor.

BitField.Name: reg001_b5
BitField.Notes: 1 = power down the input data receiver.

BitField.Name: reg001_b6
BitField.Notes: 1 = power down Q DAC.

BitField.Name: reg001_b7
BitField.Notes: 1 = power down I DAC.

BitField.Name: reg003_b1_b0
BitField.Notes: Data receiver interface mode. See the LVDS Input Data Ports section for information about the operation of the different interface modes.

Option.Description: 00 = word mode; 16-bit interface bus width
01 = byte mode; 8-bit interface bus width
10 = nibble mode; 4-bit interface bus width

BitField.Name: reg003_b5
BitField.Notes: Swaps the bit order of the data input port.

Option.Description: 0 = order of the data bits corresponds to the pin descriptions
1 = bit designations are swapped; most significant bits become the least significant bits

BitField.Name: reg003_b6
BitField.Notes: Indicates I/Q data pairing on data input.

Option.Description: 0 = I data sent to data receiver first
1 = Q data sent to data receiver first
0 = input data is in twos complement format
1 = input data is in binary format

BitField.Name: reg004_b0
BitField.Notes: 1 = enable interrupt for FIFO Warning 2.

BitField.Name: reg004_b1
BitField.Notes: 1 = enable interrupt for FIFO Warning 1.

BitField.Name: reg004_b4
BitField.Notes: 1 = enable interrupt for sync signal locked.

BitField.Name: reg004_b5
BitField.Notes: 1 = enable interrupt for sync signal lost.

BitField.Name: reg004_b6
BitField.Notes: 1 = enable interrupt for PLL locked.

BitField.Name: reg004_b7
BitField.Notes: 1 = enable interrupt for PLL lock lost.

BitField.Name: reg005_b2
BitField.Notes: 1 = enable interrupt for SED comparison fail.

BitField.Name: reg005_b3
BitField.Notes: 1 = enable interrupt for AED comparison fail.

BitField.Name: reg005_b4
BitField.Notes: 1 = enable interrupt for AED comparison pass.

Register.Name: reg006
Register.Notes: Default value: N/A. Note that all event flags are cleared by writing the respective bit high.

BitField.Name: reg006_b0
BitField.Notes: 1 = indicates that the difference between the FIFO read and write pointers is 2.

BitField.Name: reg006_b1
BitField.Notes: 1 = indicates that the difference between the FIFO read and write pointers is 1.

BitField.Name: reg006_b4
BitField.Notes: 1 = indicates that the sync logic has achieved sync alignment. This is indicated when no phase changes were requested for at least a few full averaging cycles.

BitField.Name: reg006_b5
BitField.Notes: 1 = indicates that the sync logic, which had been previously locked, has lost alignment. This is a latched signal.

BitField.Name: reg006_b6
BitField.Notes: 1 = indicates that the PLL has locked to the reference clock input.

BitField.Name: reg006_b7
BitField.Notes: 1 = indicates that the PLL, which had been previously locked, has unlocked from the reference signal. This is a latched signal.

Register.Name: reg007
Register.Notes: Default value: N/A. Note that all event flags are cleared by writing the respective bit high.

BitField.Name: reg007_b2
BitField.Notes: 1 = indicates that the SED logic detected an invalid input data pattern compared against the preprogrammed expected values. This is a latched signal.

BitField.Name: reg007_b3
BitField.Notes: 1 = indicates that the SED logic detected an invalid input data pattern compared against the preprogrammed expected values. This latched signal is automatically cleared when eight valid I/Q data pairs are received.

BitField.Name: reg007_b4
BitField.Notes: 1 = indicates that the SED logic detected a valid input data pattern compared against the preprogrammed expected values. This is a latched signal.

BitField.Name: reg008_b4
BitField.Notes: 1 = enable differential crossing correction on the REFCLK input.

BitField.Name: reg008_b5
BitField.Notes: 1 = enable differential crossing correction on the DACCLK input.

BitField.Name: reg008_b6
BitField.Notes: 1 = enable duty cycle correction on the REFCLK input.

BitField.Name: reg008_b7
BitField.Notes: 1 = enable duty cycle correction on the DACCLK input.

BitField.Name: reg00A_b5_b0
BitField.Notes: Selects the VCO band to be used.

BitField.Name: reg00A_b6
BitField.Notes: 1 = enable manual selection of the VCO band. The correct VCO band must be determined by the user and written to Bits[5:0].

BitField.Name: reg00A_b7
BitField.Notes: 1 = enable the PLL clock multiplier. The REFCLK input is used as the PLL reference clock signal.

BitField.Name: reg00C_b4_b0
BitField.Notes: Sets the nominal PLL charge pump current. 00000 = lowest current setting. ... 11111 = highest current setting.

BitField.Name: reg00C_b7_b6
BitField.Notes: Selects the PLL loop filter bandwidth. 00 = widest bandwidth. ... 11 = narrowest bandwidth.

BitField.Name: reg00D_b1_b0
BitField.Notes: PLL loop divider. This divider determines the ratio of the DACCLK frequency to the REFCLK frequency.

Option.Description: 00 = fDACCLK/fREFCLK = 2
01 = fDACCLK/fREFCLK = 4
10 = fDACCLK/fREFCLK = 8
11 = fDACCLK/fREFCLK = 16

BitField.Name: reg00D_b3_b2
BitField.Notes: PLL VCO divider. This divider determines the ratio of the VCO frequency to the DACCLK frequency.

Option.Description: 00 = fVCO/fDACCLK = 1
01 = fVCO/fDACCLK = 2
10 = fVCO/fDACCLK = 4
11 = fVCO/fDACCLK = 4

BitField.Name: reg00D_b4
BitField.Notes: 1 = enable PLL cross-point controller.

BitField.Name: reg00D_b7_b6
BitField.Notes: PLL control clock divider. This divider determines the ratio of the DACCLK frequency to the PLL controller clock frequency. fPC_CLK must always be less than 75 MHz.

Option.Description: 00 = fDACCLK/fPC_CLK = 2
01 = fDACCLK/fPC_CLK = 4
10 = fDACCLK/fPC_CLK = 8
11 = fDACCLK/fPC_CLK = 16

BitField.Name: reg00E_b3_b0
BitField.Notes: VCO control voltage readback. See Table 24 of the datasheet.

BitField.Name: reg00E_b7
BitField.Notes: 1 = the PLL-generated clock is tracking the REFCLK input signal.

BitField.Name: reg00F_b5_b0
BitField.Notes: Indicates the VCO band currently selected.

BitField.Name: reg010_b2_b0
BitField.Notes: Sets the number of input samples that are averaged in determining the sync phase.

Option.Description: 0 = sync is initiated on the falling edge of the sync input
1 = sync is initiated on the rising edge of the sync input
0 = operate the synchronization at the FIFO reset rate
1 = operate the synchronization at the data rate

BitField.Name: reg010_b7
BitField.Notes: 1 = enable the synchronization logic.

BitField.Name: reg011_b5_b0
BitField.Notes: This register sets the requested clock phase offset after sync. The offset unit is in DACCLK cycles. This register enables repositioning of the DAC output with respect to the sync input. The offset can also be used to skew the DAC outputs between the synchronized DACs. 000000 = 0 DACCLK cycles. 000001 = 1 DACCLK cycle. ... 111111 = 63 DACCLK cycles.

BitField.Name: reg012_b6
BitField.Notes: 1 = synchronization has been attained.

BitField.Name: reg012_b7
BitField.Notes: 1 = synchronization was attained but has been lost.

BitField.Name: reg013_b7_b0
BitField.Notes: Indicates the averaged sync phase offset (6.2 format). If this value differs from the Sync Phase Request[5:0] value in Register 0x11, a sync timing error has occurred. For more information, see the Sync Status Bits section. 00000000 = 0.0. 00000001 = 0.25. ... 11111110 = 63.50. 11111111 = 63.75.

BitField.Name: reg015_b0
BitField.Notes: One or more LVDS Dx input signals have crossed below 0.7 V.

BitField.Name: reg015_b1
BitField.Notes: One or more LVDS Dx input signals have exceeded 1.7 V.

BitField.Name: reg015_b2
BitField.Notes: One or both LVDS DCI input signals have crossed below 0.7 V.

BitField.Name: reg015_b3
BitField.Notes: One or both LVDS DCI input signals have exceeded 1.7 V.

BitField.Name: reg015_b4
BitField.Notes: One or both LVDS FRAME input signals have crossed below 0.7 V.

BitField.Name: reg015_b5
BitField.Notes: One or both LVDS FRAME input signals have exceeded 1.7 V.

BitField.Name: reg016_b1_b0
BitField.Notes: This option is available for the Revision 2 silicon only. The DCI delay bits control the delay applied to the DCI signal. The DCI delay affects the sampling interval of the DCI with respect to the Dx inputs. See Table 13 of the datasheet.

Option.Description: 00 = 350 ps delay of DCI signal
01 = 590 ps delay of DCI signal
10 = 800 ps delay of DCI signal
11 = 925 ps delay of DCI signal

BitField.Name: reg017_b2_b0
BitField.Notes: FIFO write pointer phase offset following FIFO reset. This is the difference between the read pointer and the write pointer values upon FIFO reset. The optimal value is nominally 4.

BitField.Name: reg018_b1
BitField.Notes: 1 = request FIFO read and write pointer alignment via the serial port

BitField.Name: reg018_b2
BitField.Notes: 1 = FIFO read and write pointers are aligned after a serial port initiated FIFO reset.

BitField.Name: reg018_b6
BitField.Notes: 1 = FIFO read and write pointers are within +-2.

BitField.Name: reg018_b7
BitField.Notes: 1 = FIFO read and write pointers are within +-1.

BitField.Name: reg019_b7_b0
BitField.Notes: Thermometer encoded measure of the FIFO level.

BitField.Name: reg01B_b0
BitField.Notes: 1 = ignore Q data from the interface and disable the clocks to the Q datapath. Send I data to both the I and Q DACs.

BitField.Name: reg01B_b1
BitField.Notes: 0 = the modulator outputs the high-side image. 1 = the modulator outputs the low-side image. The image is spectrally inverted compared to the input data.

Option.Description: 0 = the modulator outputs the high-side image
1 = the modulator outputs the low-side image

BitField.Name: reg01B_b2
BitField.Description: Bypass phase comp and dc offset
BitField.Notes: 1 = bypass phase compensation and dc offset.

BitField.Name: reg01B_b3
BitField.Notes: 0 = no gain scaling is applied to the NCO input to the internal digital modulator (default). 1 = gain scaling of 0.5 is applied to the NCO input to the internal digital modulator. Gain scaling can eliminate satu-ration of the modulator output for some combinations of data inputs and NCO signals.

Option.Description: 0 = no gain scaling is applied to the NCO input
1 = gain scaling of 0.5 is applied to the NCO input

BitField.Name: reg01B_b5
BitField.Notes: 1 = bypass the NCO.

BitField.Name: reg01B_b6
BitField.Notes: 1 = bypass the inverse sinc filter.

BitField.Name: reg01B_b7
BitField.Notes: 1 = bypass the fS/2 premodulator

BitField.Name: reg01C_b0
BitField.Notes: 1 = bypass the first-stage interpolation filter.

BitField.Name: reg01C_b2_b1
BitField.Notes: Modulation mode for I Side Half-Band Filter 1. 00 = input signal not modulated; filter pass band is from -0.4 to +0.4 of fIN1. 01 = input signal not modulated; filter pass band is from 0.1 to 0.9 of fIN1. 10 = input signal modulated by fIN1; filter pass band is from 0.6 to 1.4 of fIN1. 11 = input signal modulated by fIN1; filter pass band is from 1.1 to 1.9 of fIN1.

Option.Description: 0 = filter pass band: -0.4 to +0.4 of fIN1
1 = filter pass band: 0.1 to 0.9 of fIN1
2 = filter pass band: 0.6 to 1.4 of fIN1
3 = filter pass band: 1.1 to 1.9 of fIN1

BitField.Name: reg01D_b0
BitField.Notes: 1 = bypass the second-stage interpolation filter.

BitField.Name: reg01D_b6_b1
BitField.Notes: Modulation mode for I Side Half-Band Filter 2. 0 = input signal not modulated; filter pass band is from -0.25 to +0.25 of fIN2. 9 = input signal not modulated; filter pass band is from 0.0 to 0.5 of fIN2. 18 = input signal not modulated; filter pass band is from 0.25 to 0.75 of fIN2. 27 = input signal not modulated; filter pass band is from 0.5 to 1.0 of fIN2. 36 = input signal modulated by fIN2; filter pass band is from 0.75 to 1.25 of fIN2. 45 = input signal modulated by fIN2; filter pass band is from 1.0 to 1.5 of fIN2. 54 = input signal modulated by fIN2; filter pass band is from 1.25 to 1.75 of fIN2. 63 = input signal modulated by fIN2; filter pass band is from 1.5 to 2.0 of fIN2.

Option.Description: 0 = filter pass band: -0.25 to +0.25 of fIN2
9 = filter pass band: 0.0 to 0.5 of fIN2
18 = filter pass band: 0.25 to 0.75 of fIN2
27 = filter pass band: 0.5 to 1.0 of fIN2
36 = filter pass band: 0.75 to 1.25 of fIN2
45 = filter pass band: 1.0 to 1.5 of fIN2
54 = filter pass band: 1.25 to 1.75 of fIN2
63 = filter pass band: 1.5 to 2.0 of fIN2

BitField.Name: reg01E_b0
BitField.Notes: 1 = bypass the third-stage interpolation filter.

BitField.Name: reg01E_b6_b1
BitField.Notes: Modulation mode for I Side Half-Band Filter 3. 0 = input signal not modulated; filter pass band is from -0.2 to +0.2 of fIN3. 9 = input signal not modulated; filter pass band is from 0.05 to 0.45 of fIN3. 18 = input signal not modulated; filter pass band is from 0.3 to 0.7 of fIN3. 27 = input signal not modulated; filter pass band is from 0.55 to 0.95 of fIN3. 36 = input signal modulated by fIN3; filter pass band is from 0.8 to 1.2 of fIN3. 45 = input signal modulated by fIN3; filter pass band is from 1.05 to 1.45 of fIN3. 54 = input signal modulated by fIN3; filter pass band is from 1.3 to 1.7 of fIN3. 64 = input signal modulated by fIN3; filter pass band is from 1.55 to 1.95 of fIN3.

Option.Description: 0 = filter pass band: −0.2 to +0.2 of fIN3
9 = filter pass band: 0.05 to 0.45 of fIN3
18 = filter pass band: 0.3 to 0.7 of fIN3
27 = filter pass band: 0.55 to 0.95 of fIN3
36 = filter pass band: 0.8 to 1.2 of fIN3
45 = filter pass band: 1.05 to 1.45 of fIN3
54 = filter pass band: 1.3 to 1.7 of fIN3
63 = filter pass band: 1.55 to 1.95 of fIN3

BitField.Name: reg01F_b7_b0
BitField.Notes: This register identifies the device as an AD9122.

BitField.Name: reg030_b7_b0
BitField.Notes: See Register 0x33.

BitField.Name: reg031_b7_b0
BitField.Notes: See Register 0x33.

BitField.Name: reg032_b7_b0
BitField.Notes: See Register 0x33.

BitField.Name: reg033_b7_b0
BitField.Notes: FTW[31:0] is the 32-bit frequency tuning word that deter-mines the frequency of the complex carrier generated by the on-chip NCO. The frequency is not updated when the FTW registers are written. The values are only updated when Bit 0 of Register 0x36 transitions from 0 to 1.

BitField.Name: reg034_b7_b0
BitField.Notes: See Register 0x35.

BitField.Name: reg035_b7_b0
BitField.Notes: The NCO sets the phase of the complex carrier signal when the NCO is reset. The phase offset spans from 0 degrees to 360 degrees. Each bit represents an offset of 0.0055 degrees. This value is in twos complement format.

BitField.Name: reg036_b0
BitField.Notes: The FTW is updated on the 0-to-1 transition of this bit.

BitField.Name: reg036_b1
BitField.Notes: 1 = the FTW has been updated.

BitField.Name: reg036_b4
BitField.Notes: 0 = the NCO is reset on the first extended FRAME pulse after this bit is set to 1.

BitField.Name: reg036_b5
BitField.Notes: 1 = the NCO has been reset due to an extended FRAME pulse signal.

BitField.Name: reg038_b7_b0
BitField.Notes: See Register 0x39.

BitField.Name: reg039_b1_b0
BitField.Notes: I Phase Adj[9:0] is used to insert a phase offset between the I and Q datapaths. This offset can be used to correct for phase imbalance in a quadrature modulator. See the Quadrature Phase Correction section in the datasheet for more information.

BitField.Name: reg03A_b7_b0
BitField.Notes: See Register 0x3B.

BitField.Name: reg03B_b1_b0
BitField.Notes: Q Phase Adj[9:0] is used to insert a phase offset between the I and Q datapaths. This offset can be used to correct for phase imbalance in a quadrature modulator. See the Quadrature Phase Correction section in the datasheet for more information.

BitField.Name: reg03C_b7_b0
BitField.Notes: See Register 0x3D.

BitField.Name: reg03D_b7_b0
BitField.Notes: I DAC Offset[15:0] is a value that is added directly to the samples written to the I DAC.

BitField.Name: reg03E_b7_b0
BitField.Notes: See Register 0x3F.

BitField.Name: reg03F_b7_b0
BitField.Notes: Q DAC Offset[15:0] is a value that is added directly to the samples written to the Q DAC.

BitField.Name: reg040_b7_b0
BitField.Notes: See Register 0x41, Bits[1:0].

BitField.Name: reg041_b1_b0
BitField.Notes: I DAC FS Adj[9:0] sets the full-scale current of the I DAC. The full-scale current can be adjusted from 8.64 mA to 31.68 mA in step sizes of approximately 22.5 uA. 0x000 = 8.64 mA. ... 0x200 = 20.16 mA. ... 0x3FF = 31.68 mA.

BitField.Name: reg041_b7
BitField.Notes: 1 = puts the I DAC into sleep mode (fast wake-up mode).

BitField.Name: reg042_b7_b0
BitField.Notes: See Register 0x43, Bits[1:0].

BitField.Name: reg043_b1_b0
BitField.Notes: I Aux DAC[9:0] sets the magnitude of the auxiliary DAC current. The range is 0 mA to 2 mA, and the step size is 2 uA. 0x000 = 0.000 mA. 0x001 = 0.002 mA. ... 0x3FF = 2.046 mA.

BitField.Name: reg043_b5
BitField.Notes: 1 = puts the I auxiliary DAC into sleep mode.

Option.Description: 0 = the I auxiliary DAC sources current
1 = the I auxiliary DAC sinks current

BitField.Name: reg043_b7
BitField.Notes: 0 = the I auxiliary DAC sign is positive, and the current is directed to the IOUT1P pin (Pin 67). 1 = the I auxiliary DAC sign is negative, and the current is directed to the IOUT1N pin (Pin 66).

Option.Description: 0 = the I auxiliary DAC sign is positive
1 = the I auxiliary DAC sign is negative

BitField.Name: reg044_b7_b0
BitField.Notes: See Register 0x45, Bits[1:0].

BitField.Name: reg045_b1_b0
BitField.Notes: Q DAC FS Adj[9:0] sets the full-scale current of the Q DAC. The full-scale current can be adjusted from 8.64 mA to 31.68 mA in step sizes of approximately 22.5 uA. 0x000 = 8.64 mA. ... 0x200 = 20.16 mA. ... 0x3FF = 31.68 mA.

BitField.Name: reg045_b7
BitField.Notes: 1 = puts the Q DAC into sleep mode (fast wake-up mode).

BitField.Name: reg046_b7_b0
BitField.Notes: See Register 0x47, Bits[1:0].

BitField.Name: reg047_b1_b0
BitField.Notes: Q Aux DAC[9:0] sets the magnitude of the auxiliary DAC current. The range is 0 mA to 2 mA, and the step size is 2 uA. 0x000 = 0.000 mA. 0x001 = 0.002 mA. ... 0x3FF = 2.046 mA.

BitField.Name: reg047_b5
BitField.Notes: 1 = puts the Q auxiliary DAC into sleep mode.

Option.Description: 0 = the Q auxiliary DAC sources current
1 = the Q auxiliary DAC sinks current

BitField.Name: reg047_b7
BitField.Notes: 0 = the Q auxiliary DAC sign is positive, and the current is directed to the IOUT2P pin (Pin 58). 1 = the Q auxiliary DAC sign is negative, and the current is directed to the IOUT2N pin (Pin 59).

Option.Description: 0 = the Q auxiliary DAC sign is positive
1 = the Q auxiliary DAC sign is negative

BitField.Name: reg048_b0
BitField.Notes: Auxiliary ADC internal capacitor value.

Option.Description: 0 = 5 pF

BitField.Name: reg048_b3_b1
BitField.Notes: Auxiliary ADC reference current. 000 = lowest current. ... 111 = highest current.

BitField.Name: reg048_b6_b4
BitField.Notes: Auxiliary ADC full-scale current. 000 = lowest current. ... 111 = highest current.

BitField.Name: reg049_b7_b0
BitField.Notes: See Register 0x4A.

BitField.Name: reg04A_b7_b0
BitField.Notes: Die Temp[15:0] indicates the approximate die temperature. For more information, see the Temperature Sensor section in the datasheet.

BitField.Name: reg067_b0
BitField.Notes: 1 = indicates that the last sample comparison was error free.

BitField.Name: reg067_b1
BitField.Notes: 1 = indicates an error was detected. This bit remains set until it is autocleared by the reception of eight consecutive error-free comparisons or is cleared by a write to this register.

BitField.Name: reg067_b3
BitField.Notes: 1 = enable autoclear mode. This activates Bit 1 and Bit 0 of this register and causes Register 0x70 through Register 0x73 to be autocleared when eight consecutive sample data sets are received error free.

BitField.Name: reg067_b5
BitField.Notes: 1 = indicates an error was detected. The bit remains set until cleared. Any write to this register clears this bit to 0.

BitField.Name: reg067_b7
BitField.Notes: 1 = enable the SED circuitry. None of the flags in this register or the values in Register 0x70 through Register 0x73 are significant if the SED is not enabled.

BitField.Name: reg068_b7_b0
BitField.Notes: See Register 0x69.

BitField.Name: reg069_b7_b0
BitField.Notes: Compare Value I0[15:0] is the word that is compared with the I0 input sample captured at the input interface.

BitField.Name: reg06A_b7_b0
BitField.Notes: See Register 0x6B.

BitField.Name: reg06B_b7_b0
BitField.Notes: Compare Value Q0[15:0] is the word that is compared with the Q0 input sample captured at the input interface.

BitField.Name: reg06C_b7_b0
BitField.Notes: See Register 0x6D.

BitField.Name: reg06D_b7_b0
BitField.Notes: Compare Value I1[15:0] is the word that is compared with the I1 input sample captured at the input interface.

BitField.Name: reg06E_b7_b0
BitField.Notes: See Register 0x6F.

BitField.Name: reg06F_b7_b0
BitField.Notes: Compare Value Q1[15:0] is the word that is compared with the Q1 input sample captured at the input interface.

BitField.Name: reg070_b7_b0
BitField.Notes: See Register 0x71.

BitField.Name: reg071_b7_b0
BitField.Notes: Errors Detected I_BITS[15:0] indicates which bits were received in error.

BitField.Name: reg072_b7_b0
BitField.Notes: See Register 0x73.

BitField.Name: reg073_b7_b0
BitField.Notes: Errors Detected Q_BITS[15:0] indicates which bits were received in error.

BitField.Name: reg07F_b5_b2
BitField.Notes: This value corresponds to the die revision number.

Option.Description: 0001 = Die Revision 1
0011 = Die Revision 2
